titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

div.p: As long as men have eyes as well as ears, they will think they see your meaning as well as hear it; & they are more apt to believe their sight than their hearing, as being the more perfect sense. All that a preacher doth is a kind of preaching: & when you live a covetous or a careless life, you preach those sins to your people by your practice.

body.p: Ella went off to Scotland by the morning express.

The "Times" announces that the Government have granted a Select Committee of the House to inquire into the measure of responsibility attaching to the Directors of the Peruvian Amazon Cy for the Putumayo atrocities.
I visited the dentist, returning thro' the Park. I fell in with Lord Emmott, who told me that a Select Committee would have power to compel attendance of persons, & production of documents.
